title: Deuteronomy Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Deuteronomy with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 34 chapters.

questions.question: Who began to declare the law on this side of the Jordan, in the land of Moab?
questions.explanation: Moses began to declare the law to the children of Israel on this side Jordan, in the land of Moab.

questions.question: How many men did Moses take to search out the land of Canaan, one from each tribe?
questions.explanation: Moses took twelve men, one from each tribe, to spy out the land.

questions.question: What was the report of the spies about the land?
options: It is a land of giants
It is a land of deserts
questions.explanation: The spies reported that the land was good, as the LORD our God gives us.

questions.question: Who among the generation was allowed to enter the promised land because he wholly followed the LORD?
questions.explanation: Caleb, son of Jephunneh, was allowed to enter because he wholly followed the LORD.

questions.question: Who was appointed to succeed Moses and lead the Israelites into the promised land?
questions.explanation: Joshua, son of Nun, was appointed to lead Israel into the promised land.

questions.question: How did the LORD go before the Israelites to show them the way?
options: In fire by night and a cloud by day
questions.correctAnswer: In fire by night and a cloud by day
questions.explanation: The LORD went before them in fire by night and a cloud by day to guide them.

questions.question: True or False: Moses was able to bear the burden of the people alone without appointing leaders.
questions.explanation: Moses said he was not able to bear the burden alone and appointed leaders.

questions.question: What did the people say when Moses suggested appointing leaders over them?
options: It is good for us to do
We will choose our own leaders
questions.correctAnswer: It is good for us to do
questions.explanation: The people agreed that appointing leaders was good.

questions.question: Where did Moses command the judges to hear causes and judge righteously?
questions.explanation: Moses charged judges to hear causes between brethren and judge righteously at the gates.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'The LORD your God hath multiplied you, and, behold, ye are this day as the ______ of heaven for multitude.'
questions.explanation: Israel is compared to the stars of heaven for multitude.

questions.question: Why did the Israelites refuse to go up and possess the land after the spies returned?
options: Because the cities were great and walled up
questions.explanation: They were discouraged by the size of the people, walled cities, and Anakims.

questions.question: What did the LORD swear about the generation that rebelled against Him?
options: They shall not enter the promised land
They shall wander in the wilderness for 40 years
They shall perish in the wilderness
questions.correctAnswer: They shall not enter the promised land
questions.explanation: The LORD swore that none of that evil generation would see the good land.

questions.question: True or False: Moses was allowed to enter the promised land because he led the people faithfully.
questions.explanation: Moses was not allowed to enter because of previous disobedience.

questions.question: In Deuteronomy 9, what reason does Moses give for Israel possessing the land?
options: Because of the wickedness of the nations
questions.correctAnswer: Because of the wickedness of the nations
questions.explanation: God drives out nations not for Israel's righteousness, but due to the wickedness of those nations.

questions.question: How long did Moses stay on the mount to receive the tables of stone?
questions.explanation: Moses stayed forty days and nights on the mount.

questions.question: What did Moses do when he saw the people had made a molten calf?
options: He broke the two tables of stone
questions.explanation: Moses prayed, broke the tablets, and destroyed the calf.

questions.question: True or False: The LORD was very angry with Aaron for making the golden calf and Moses did not pray for him.
questions.explanation: The LORD was angry with Aaron but Moses prayed for him.

questions.question: At which locations did the Israelites provoke the LORD to wrath, according to Deuteronomy 9?
questions.explanation: These were key places of Israel's rebellion in the wilderness.

questions.question: True or False: Moses reminded Israel that the LORD was bringing them into a land with cities great and fenced up to heaven.
questions.explanation: Moses warned that they would face mighty nations and fortified cities.

questions.question: What warning is given about the sacrifice of bulls or sheep with blemishes?
options: They are an abomination to the LORD
They should be offered only in emergencies
They are preferred for sin offerings
questions.correctAnswer: They are an abomination to the LORD
questions.explanation: Sacrifices with blemishes are forbidden as abominations.

questions.question: If a man or woman is found to have served other gods, what is the prescribed punishment?
questions.explanation: The offender is to be brought to the gates and stoned until death.

questions.question: How many witnesses are required to put a person to death for a capital offense?
questions.explanation: At the mouth of two or three witnesses, the death penalty is applied.

questions.question: True or False: The king of Israel may multiply horses and wives according to his own will.
questions.explanation: The king should not multiply horses or wives to prevent turning away from God.

questions.question: What book was the king to write for himself, to keep with him and read all his days?
questions.explanation: The king was to write a copy of the law to read and learn.

questions.question: True or False: The king must not consider himself above his brethren but must fear God always.
questions.explanation: The king is instructed to remain humble and reverent before God.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Thou shalt fear the LORD thy God; him shalt thou serve, and to him shalt thou cleave, and swear by his name.'
questions.explanation: The verse emphasizes serving and cleaving to the LORD.

questions.question: What reason does Moses give for Israel's stiffnecked nature?
options: Because they were rebellious from Egypt
Because they had not learned God's ways
Because they provoked God to wrath
questions.correctAnswer: Because they provoked God to wrath
questions.explanation: Israel was stiffnecked and rebellious, provoking God to wrath.

questions.question: True or False: Moses fasted and prayed for Israel forty days and forty nights twice.
questions.explanation: Moses prayed and fasted twice for forty days and nights for Israel’s sins.

questions.question: What is the warning given about respecting persons in judgment?
options: Do not respect persons; judge righteously
questions.correctAnswer: Do not respect persons; judge righteously
questions.explanation: Judges must not respect persons but judge fairly.

questions.question: Where did Moses say the LORD had borne Israel as a man bears his son?
questions.explanation: The LORD bore Israel in the wilderness like a man bears his son.

questions.question: True or False: Moses commands Israel to fear not and be not discouraged when going up to possess the land.
questions.explanation: Moses encourages Israel not to fear or be discouraged.

questions.question: What did Moses charge the judges to do when the matter was too hard for them?
questions.explanation: Judges were to bring difficult matters to Moses.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And the LORD heard the voice of your words, and was wroth, and sware, saying, Surely there shall not one of these men of this evil generation see that good ______.'
questions.explanation: God swore the evil generation would not see the good land.

questions.question: Who was allowed to enter the promised land along with the children according to Deuteronomy 1?
questions.explanation: Caleb and the children who had no knowledge between good and evil were allowed.

questions.question: True or False: The LORD commanded Moses to break the tablets of the covenant when he saw the people’s sin.
questions.explanation: Moses broke the tablets in anger after seeing the golden calf.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Remember thy servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; look not unto the stubbornness of this people, nor to their wickedness, nor to their ______.'
questions.explanation: Moses prayed that God would not consider Israel's sin.

questions.question: What was Moses instructed to do with the dust of the ground calf?
questions.explanation: Moses ground the calf to dust and cast it into the brook.

questions.question: True or False: According to Deuteronomy 9, the LORD promised to destroy the people because of their sins without any intercession.
questions.explanation: Moses interceded in prayer, and the LORD spared the people.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 17, what must be done if an accusation is made but no witnesses are found?
questions.explanation: False witnesses are punished to remain innocent.

questions.question: True or False: The king must write a copy of the law for himself and read it so he may learn to fear the LORD his God and keep all the words of this law.
questions.explanation: This was to ensure the king remained humble and obedient.

questions.question: What kind of people were the Israelites described as in Deuteronomy 9?
questions.explanation: They are described as a stiffnecked people.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Hear, O Israel: The LORD our God is one LORD:'
questions.explanation: This is the Shema, a central declaration in Deuteronomy.

questions.question: True or False: Moses reminded Israel that God bore them in the wilderness as a man bears his son.
questions.explanation: This metaphor expresses God's tender care.

questions.question: What was the primary reason given for God's anger against Israel in the wilderness?
questions.explanation: Their rebellion provoked God's wrath.

questions.question: True or False: Moses commanded the people to go in and possess the land which the LORD swore to give to their fathers.
questions.explanation: Moses exhorted them to possess the promised land.
